basics.name: Joel Nicolow
basics.label: Graduate Research Assistant
basics.summary: I am a Master’s student at the University of Hawai‘i Manoa where I study Computer Science. I expect to graduate in Fall 2025

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.company: Coastal Research Collaborative, University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Training and evaluating U-net and other convolution-based image segmentation models in Pytorch and TensorFlow to segment coastal features such as beach area and the land/water interface.
Created an open-source Python Framework named CoastVision which downloads PlanetScope imagery for a given area of interest, then segments the shoreline in each image
CoastVision framework was used to measure coastal erosion rates across the island of Oahu which are used to inform policy decisions

work.company: Water Resources Research Center, University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Training and evaluating image classification and regression models with ResNet backbones in Pytorch
Predicting fog presence and visibility from trail camera images on Hawaiian mountains using these models

work.company: Coastal Research Collaborative, University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Working with APIs to download PlanetScope and Google Earth Engine satellite imagery
Training and evaluating pixel classification image segmentation models in Scikit-learn learn to segment coastal features such as beach area and the land/water interface.
Created Python framework to download imagery and perform image segmentation on it to track coastal changes

work.company: Hawaii Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research Change(HI)
highlights: Training and evaluating image classification and regression models with ResNet backbones in Pytorch
Trained and evaluated machine learning models using Scikit-learn to classify fog presence in trail camera images based on engineered image features
Poster presentation at the 2023 American Geophysical Union’s Fall Meeting in San Francisco
Poster Presentation at the 20204 Hawaii Conservation Conference
Awarded Outstanding Undergraduate Student Poster Presentation at the 2024 Hawaii Conservation Conference

work.company: The University of Hawaii Manoa, Honolulu Community College
highlights: Trained and evaluated machine learning models using Scikit-learn to classify fog presence in trail camera images based on engineered image features
Created Python framework to process relative humidity, temperature, and dew point data from multiple meteorologic stations
Successfully attained funding from the Associated Students of the University of Hawaii
Poster Presentation at the 20204 Hawaii Conservation Conference
Co-author on published poster in the Hawai‘i Conservation Conference July 2022
Co-author on published poster in the American Geophysical Union December 2022

work.company: Pacific Health Analytics Collaborative, University of Hawaii Manoa
highlights: Created R frameworks to automate web scraping of data dashboards
Generated aggregate data tables from observation-level data using LaTex and R
Helped develop the Hawaii Behavioral Health Dashboard using R, Power BI, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Co-author on Hawaii Opioid Initiative Evaluation Report 2020
Co-author on Hawaii State Plan for a Data-Driven System of Care on Substance Use 2022

volunteer.summary: During the summer of 2022 while living in Kailua I went to Hoʻokuaʻāina when I had available days because Hawaiʻi's food sustainability and mālama ʻāina are very important to me.

awards.title: Outstanding Undergraduate Student Poster Presentation Award
awards.awarder: Hawaiʻi Conservation Alliance & The Wildlife Society: Hawaiʻi Chapter
awards.summary: I was honored to be awarded the ‘Outstanding Undergraduate Student Poster Presentation’ award at the 2024 Hawaiʻi Conservation Conference for my poster 'A Machine Learning Method for Detecting Fog in Mountain Trail Camera Images'

awards.title: Research Award
awards.awarder: Associated Students of the University of Hawaiʻi
awards.summary: Research award obtained to finance trail cameras for meteorologic research on Mount Kaʻala

awards.title: Project funding
